entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: Yesterday's @BBCCountry file reminded us yet again that it's the citizen scientists @FriendsUpperWye  who now seem responsible for monitoring the health of our rivers. The re-funding of our water regulators @WaterNRW @EnvAgency so they can do their job properly is such a priority https://t.co/dtvvPPQb9P

@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Thank you isn‚Äôt enough.  My heart aches for us all, there‚Äôs no way out, we try but nothing gets better. They won‚Äôt stop us though, your thoughtfulness helps us to stay strong @StinkStopthe xxx

tweets.text:
Bathing water season has started! 

To help you plan, you can check how clean the water is at your local beach or further afield before heading out. 

Check the water quality of your local beach: https://t.co/1uiKhnztLS https://t.co/DSNaRDq0Do

We recently patrolled #Hanningfield Reservoir and the River Chelmer with @EP_RURAL, @AnglingTrust and Hanningfield Rangers.

28 people were checked and 3 were reported for fisheries offences.  

Buy your fishing licence here: https://t.co/EL8RJbio0s #Essex #Fishing https://t.co/GRWROZDRXa

Great discussions today @BritGeoSurvey on spatiotemporal data and @opengeospatial OGCAPI - Environmental Data Retrieval and SensorThingsAPI. Looking forward to hearing what @metoffice & @EnvAgency are doing soon #Data #datastandards #Standards #Fairdata

Great to see @Go_CheshireWest Council Leader Louise Gittins visit our Sustainable Urban Drainage project at @cheshire_hub on Friday. The @EnvAgency funded Rainzone project is delivered by @MyNorthwich team tackling localised flooding whilst creating space to grow fresh produce. https://t.co/5OStCxb582

Attention wildlife-friendly #farmers, facilitators & advisors! 
Free webinar exploring the varied opportunities for funding environmental work, w/ Alison Baker @EnvAgency, Paul Cottington @NFUsouthwest,  Dan Turner @theriverstrust, @JennyPhelpsMBE
Book at: https://t.co/m3R0OEXv82 https://t.co/s6GVeLyfNG

tweets.text: .@BBCCountryfile highlights the crisis of our rivers. @NRW says no direct link between poultry farming and  Wye's pollution. Citizen scientists @FriendsUpperWye find huge phosphate spike in river as soon as it passes the IPUs. Apathy & inactivity of our regulators is shocking

NFRS are in attendance on the B6348 Chatton at a Trailer overturned which has spilled fertiliser. Appliances from #Wooler #Berwick and #Seahouses are dealing with the incident with a #FlexiOfficer and the @EnvAgency have been requested to attend ...... further updates to follow

I only live a few miles from Somerset‚Äôs #coast yet haven‚Äôt been in over a yr.
Today it felt a bit coastal with a closer look at the #soil erosion in a nearby field.
A gully some 100mm or more has been scoured through the field, filling ditches and streams. https://t.co/SjXEko4QhJ
The @EnvAgencyNW flood risk management scheme is working with @CumbriaCC @SouthLakelandDC and Kendal Town Council to help deliver these actions https://t.co/DTndtoC1To
